website_summaries.verdict: The ideal product for those wanting a dual-function stand that effectively holds other items alongside cookbooks.
pros: Can easily hold extremely large cookbooks and textbooks
Comes with different tilting options for various viewing angles
Some customers also use this as a portable laptop desk
The page holders can swivel in any direction for easy reading
cons: A few customers said their stand came with defective screws, or were missing the screws entirely

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Nice backside to adjust the angle. Nice flexible page holders. Don't waste your money on the plastic one. Initially I would have given the other one a 4-5 star review but after it broke I would give it a 3 star. After using this now I would give the popular plastic one 2 stars. It simply does not compare, and for the few dollar savings it's simply not worth it. Also, I read the one star reviews and I think these people are kookoo. Either they got a defective one which is going to happen or they have lost associations with reality.
customer_reviews.author: FOOCH

customer_reviews.title: Unclear Instructions - here's a vid to help
customer_reviews.text: 3-stars: The stand seems to be high quality, but the instructions were quite unclear as to how to lock and unlock the shelf. The advertised pictures show that there are screws on the hinges but the one I received doesn't have any screws, so I literally spent like 10 minutes or more just trying to figure out how to flip the shelf down. 1 hour later - 5 stars: After experimenting for a while I'm actually glad it doesn't have screws. It works great, and I've included a vid to assist in those considering buying this to know how to fold the tray down.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Even holds ginormous nursing book.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It holds my 2,000+ paged nursing book. Now maybe I'll stop getting headaches from hunching over the table. Light weight. Super easy to use. Many viewing positions. I love the page holders. You can move them out of the way it use them to hold the page. They have rubbery like little ends to hold the page securely. It's perfect! Just what I needed! Update: I've been using it everyday for school for a while now and still no problems. I love it and would highly recommend it to students, cooks, anyone that needs a book in the upright position. Several levels to put book at any angle.
customer_reviews.author: SicilianGirl

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy book stand. Holds 600+ page book. Improves posture!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for the last two days so this review may not be the most accurate one but I'm thinking of updating in future, if anything changes. I'm using this to hold a 600+ page book and its doing its job very well so far. The angle of viewing/reading can be adjusted using the adjustable stand and the rubber grommets at the bottom makes this product not slide off on a smooth surface. My neck thanks me now. I hope this product will help many folks out there who are looking for a sturdy book stand and improve their posture. Product is made in Korea.
customer_reviews.author: Sat

customer_reviews.title: ❤️🙈❤️🙈❤️🙈❤️
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product I just want to say that's my English is weak and I'm trying to explain as much I can .... ‏The product is Portable Not heavy to Carry with you 😎
customer_reviews.author: Bayern 1988

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Video Review
customer_reviews.text: The book stand does a great job of holding my heavy (very, heavy) nursing school books, with ease. I ordered the larger size, since the majority of my school books are very heavy and large hardcovers. It's easy to adjust as well as to fold up and put away. Video review posted.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Chonkworld

customer_reviews.title: Stay away until they fix this defect.
customer_reviews.text: I felt really stupid trying to tinker with this stand to get the support arms to work. But there are supposed to be screws on the locks, which there aren't on mine. A lot of other people are receiving defective units too, so until they fix this, steer clear. It would have been a great stand if it actually worked.
customer_reviews.author: Takashin

customer_reviews.title: BestBookStand Nice Production INP-101-O Book Stand
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty nice for what it is if you choose to use it at your desk. It is really not all that portable. I always had to have books at angle to read comfortably. I have other stands that are much more portable, but not nearly as useable and convenient as this one is, however, at your desk. Not a problem from moving it from desk to a table at home, but not very practical to move them around to work and on to travel with you.
customer_reviews.author: F. Shoar

customer_reviews.title: Esthetics:  Nice from the front...
customer_reviews.text: Functionality is great. But esthetically, the product needs some work. From the front, it has nice clean modern lines. But the support in the back - while sturdy and functional - has a clunky, curved appearance that is really jarring. (I suppose some may think the embossed butterfly on the support adds a homey touch.) Check out the pictures. Also, while there were separate instructions enclosed, the manufacturer glued a large instruction sticker to the back with the kind of glue that is not easy to get off (why do they do this?). Goo-Gone and a lot of thumbnail work took care of it, but it's quite annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Marshall

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST bookstand!!
customer_reviews.text: The way it folds to become a bookstand or a writing desk is spectacular. Totally portable. I collect bookstands.. (I read a lot and am a writer.) This is the BEST by far the best bookstand and editing desk I've ever had. I bought 5 more to give as gifts for nephews who read a lot and study. I rave so much about this that my boyfriend is beginning to wonder about me. I now have 3 for myself (in different sizes.) I can pick it up, and it doesn't collapse (most reading stands collapse). It's stable and holds the pages back on big, heavy books. It folds down and the lip inverts to become a writing/editing desk. Brilliant design.
customer_reviews.author: Udana Power

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical after reading some bad reviews. Not to worry as this book stand is very well made, functional and easily holds heavy textbooks firmly in place. Doesn't tip as the center of gravity is low. I love that it's small but very sturdy and made of wood. The two arms are helpful for holding the pages down. The company lets customers know if there is any issue with the item being damaged in transit, they will rectify it. They also give clear photo instructions on how to adjust the page arms - as this seems to be difficult for some people.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonHonestReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Solid and quality construction
customer_reviews.text: Solid and quality construction. I use mostly for books and journals. Can hold small and large book. Recommended. Dimensions are (in cms): 29 lenght, 21 height and 21 cms width in full extension. See pictures with big, small and medium books.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Uribe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for students!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Light weight - easy to move around my desk when I want to use it or need to type. Looks very nice from the front - don’t see the plastic back. The page holders are very convenient. They easily stay out of the way when you don’t need them and can be moved to a wide range different positions on the page without trouble and without damaging your book. Thin page holders make it easy to work around. Holds my huge hardback textbook (~1500 pages) without a problem. Easy to adjust the angle/lean of the stand for many different viewing angles. Just what I needed and wish I would have purchased it years ago!
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: Packaging process questionable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these. They arrived in the mail in pristine boxes. When I removed the #102 model from its box, I immediately noticed that I received a scratch and dent item. I appears that somewhere between production and boxing that the product was either dropped onto something or something was dropped on top of it. There is a rather noticeable dual scratch from the center onto the left side, leaving an impression against the surface, to include a dent on the right side which has exposed the glue underneath the laminate. The boxes in which the items came are perfectly intact. Having paid for a new item, it is somewhat dissapointing to have received something scratch and dent.
customer_reviews.author: T. Vesper

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! High quality, super functional book/iPad stand
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this book stand. I use it beside my computer with a textbook, bring it to computer lab with me to make it easier on my neck to work on assignments, and with my 12.9 inch IPad Pro. It is a little heavy to carry around (about the weight of another book) but I only carry one or two books at a time, so it’s worth it to me. The weight is actually an advantage when using my iPad - it stays put when I type or swipe on it. It folds flat quickly, and the page holders are very helpful. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Fronye

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book stand. I really like that the shelf for the book and the stand in the back can all be secured so that nothing flops around when you pick it up. There are 13 different angles you can use for the stand so it’s easy to find one to give you optimum reading pleasure. It’s sturdy. And the page holders have just the right amount of weight and give. Perfect! Please see my video review for more information.
customer_reviews.author: D.G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all my book stand needs
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. I use it for all my books...different sizes, weight, etc. I also use it for my laptop so I am ordering a second one. The quality is great too. I have owned it for almost two months and I stuff it in my huge bag full of book and it's in perfect condition. I bought the smaller size one and I am sticking with the size because it's a perfect size for my books/laptop. I use it every day and there is no wear and tear on it. (no I did not get paid to write this review nor did I receive a free product...want to include this because I always wonder when I read reviews).
customer_reviews.author: dressler family

customer_reviews.title: great design
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this book stand. Its size is perfect for holding magazines and larger books as well as smaller paperbacks. The mechanism for adjusting the angle is well thought out with a spring-loaded base and multiple slots to adjust the angle from a low of 20 degrees to a high of 84 degrees. The springy fingers for holding the pages are nice and thin, so they don't obstruct your view. There are even little rubber pads on the bottom to prevent the stand from sliding around. And all the edges and corners are nicely finished. It was well worth the higher cost.
customer_reviews.author: Dave A.

customer_reviews.title: BEST BOOKSTAND!!
customer_reviews.text: This really is the best bookstand!! Great overall quality, nice wood color, so many angle notches, doesnt tip over (even if book is uneven in weight), can hold up to heavy 1000 page college textbook level support (tried it). The bookstand is really nice & sleek, you can even use it for your Macbook or anything you want. There is a light finished gloss over the wood so you dont get any wood slivers in your fingers! Also the page holders are quite strong & thin so you can still read the text while using them. awesome design, thumbs up 👍
customer_reviews.author: OC88

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have only owned this for about one week now, so I can't speak to its durability or longevity. However, I will say my initial impression is nothing but utmost satisfaction. All parts are sturdy. The back stand holds firm and doesn't wiggle. The page trapping arms maintain solid pressure on the pages and are very flexible to fit many books. The base board is solid and easily supports 600+ page books. Excellent investment that has honestly drastically increased productivity. I can read and type at the same time with ease and comfort. Much less strain on the back and neck!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Beware, Pins for Lock/Unlock Mechanism might be missing
customer_reviews.text: I just got this product today and the pins to lock/unlock the stand are broken/missing. Edit: The mechanism is updated and is supposed to look like this. The pins are no longer pointing out like the older models in the pictures. You just have to push the tiny board to lock/unlock. Other than that, the product serves its purpose and is pretty sturdy. Tutorial their customer service gave me:
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed

customer_reviews.title: Plastic material is NOT DURABLE
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this 6 times. The board material seems sturdy and light. The angle range is very good. The page clips are well designed and thin so they don’t block much text. But the plastic piece that holds the ledge in place on the right side is already cracked! This is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Conscientious Citizen

customer_reviews.title: great bookstand for the price, durable and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Really is a great stand for the price, versatile and durable. We've used it hundreds of times, for a variety of purposes including: * holding cookbooks and recipe cards in the kitchen * school textbooks for homework * holding iPad for online recipe viewing or videos * paperbacks * hardcovers and trade paperbacks It's super simple to use and adjust, folds flat so it's out of the way when not in use, and seems nearly indestructible. At around fifteen bucks, it's a great value.
customer_reviews.author: James Huff

customer_reviews.title: Arms have alot of power! Don't use on brittle books!
customer_reviews.text: Great bookstand, lot of power on those spring loaded arms. I've put giant 40 pound dictionaries on this thing, and it's held up fine. Just a note, due to the power on those arms, if you have old brittle books that have a weak spine, I might not put it on this bookstand, because it might put too much pressure on it, and cause damage to the already frail spine. The capability to adjust the arm strengthen would be cool, but of course, for how inexpensive the product is. It's already well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Not appropriate for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful stand and I wanted it because it is wood, but it just didn't work at all for my needs. The front arms that are supposed to hold the pages in place were essentially useless for anything heavier than sheets of paper, no way they worked for a book of any size, and they did not adjust well for shorter books. It just turned out to be a total bust for me unfortunately and I sent it back. Excellent return and refund policy however. I ended up getting a very basic grey metal stand which works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: lkchary

customer_reviews.title: Makes reading much more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy stand which holds a large Psychology textbook. The viewing angle is adjustable. I do not travel with it so cannot comment on the portability, but a small, barely significant gripe is that the foot of the stand which supports the bottom of a book is hinged (for portability), but sometimes folds down when I would like it to be fixed. Otherwise it is a fine stand and has saved my next and improved my posture while reading, which has significantly reduced my debilitating back spasms. Totally worth it, and am kicking myself for not having a stand for the last 40 years.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bookrest
customer_reviews.text: Initially I couldn't get the tiny levers pushed up so that I could pull down the book ledge. I used a knife and then scissors and finally got the tiny levers up so that the ledge came down..then I had to lock it by pushing the levers down to lock the ledge in place. Worth the effort! Light AND sturdy. The grips keep the bookrest from sliding and I bent the page holder a little bit to loosen so that turning the pages is easier. Bought this for my mom to hold her books. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: locking mechanism not functional- base won’t lock.... are these seconds
customer_reviews.text: Nicely finished and adjustable but can’t hold pges because the page springs were pit on backwards- waiting for return slip and replacement to see if juat a defective assembly. Second trial- Instructions state to push a tab in with your son front unlocked the lock you can’t push it in with your thumb and if you pull it down it doesn’t lock going . Because this is so high rated by others I’m going to try try all three but really wondering if these are seconds
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: I bought this book stand last year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book stand last year after my neck started hurting from studying/reading a huge neuroscience book without propping it up. It definitely solved that problem. I am currently using it for my occupational therapy books, which are extremely large and thick, and it holds the books without a problem! I have not had any issues with the springs, and I use it almost every day. The only reason why I gave it 4 stars is because the dimensions are slightly off. Regardless, the stand works great! UPDATE: This book stand is fantastic! It has held up for a year and half with no problems. I'm upgrading it to 5 stars. It is definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: MiaTop Contributor: Children's Books

customer_reviews.title: I use it for Comic Books, graphic novels & Omnibuses
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for me. Easy to adjust, fits on my lap or desk. I don’t use the clips but I can see them being helpful for other things. I was worried they would get in the way, but not at all an issue. I had wanting something exactly like this for awhile, even made two similar devices one day when I was bored. This is perfect for what I was wanting. I have used it to read a few different Marvel omnibuses and the larger format Image hardcovers (like Black Science) and it made for a comfortable reading experience. Highly recommend. Now I just need a black one, hint hint.
customer_reviews.author: sEan

customer_reviews.title: I use it for a desktop music stand!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use as a desktop music stand. and it is amazing. Very well made and sturdy. It is large enough to hold serious music books such as "Klose Method for Clarinet" and "Universal Method for Saxophone". My wife has threatened to take it for recipe holding so I guess I'll have to get another one. Did I mention that it's attractive. The finish is high quality. It is not quite as light weight as I'd thought but that weight is necessary for the inherent sturdiness of the stand. GREAT PRODUCT1
customer_reviews.author: DHinFL

customer_reviews.title: The perfect bookstand!
customer_reviews.text: Yah! This is well made, sturdy, non slipping - and beautifully designed for holding books open at any angle that suits you. Because of a stroke I only have the use of my left hand, making it so difficult to hold a book or magazine open. This solves that problem for me. The little page holders can swing out of the way for turning pages. It's truly a great design. Don't waste your time on a lesser bookstand - this is the one to make your life easier! I'll be ordering this lovely 'life-helper' in every size!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Walters

customer_reviews.title: Lots of adjustability. Works really well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite purchases--and something I probably wouldn't have found without Amazon. Works really well for what it was designed for, and the angle adjustments are really easy with many increments. Have to admit that when I'm not using it to read, I clip my bills to it, ordering the envelopes in the order they need to go out.
customer_reviews.author: John Arthur Lee (fiction writer)

customer_reviews.title: a reading enhancer
customer_reviews.text: So I try to read a little everyday, and this helps the comfort of reading. Instead of looking down on the table as I have been all my life, this stand props the book up so im looking now forward instead of down. (I have minor neck problems, and am forced to look down for my job, so reading is better and no longer adds to the time im looking down. It also has 2 little prongs to keep the pages from turning. Easy to set up and break down. I bought the big size, and am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: justin r masuda

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT BOOKSTAND
customer_reviews.text: The stand is excellent - period. It is sturdy and very well thought out. The bookrest is a little stiff the first few times you use it but that is no problem-just don't force anything. The instructions consist of a series of color photos and a few instructions. The arms work perfectly. I have used even large cookbooks with the smallest stand and even though the sides flop over the edges of the stand a little it still works very well. Liked the small stand that we bought so much I turned around and purchased the medium and large stands. These are by far the best bookstands I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: sunbird

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer Ghosted after it Broke with Normal Use
customer_reviews.text: This book stand was great...while it lasted. We used it almost every day to hold books so I could read to my kids and keep my hands free. It held board books and paper backs of all shapes and sizes. Unfortunately, it broke after a few months of regular use. I attached a picture showing that the plastic edge piece just cracked apart. There’s no way to fix it. When I emailed the company about it, they ghosted me. Because they didn’t stand behind their product, I had to give it one star.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan & Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Works well! Nice sturdy book holder. The page holders are nice and flexible and hold pages well without damage. Puchased the 12 inch and it holds the thicker textbooks just fine. I noticed on reviews that people were having trouble opening the part the book sits on but we had no issue once we saw how it worked (on the video some reviewers made). I would highly recommend this one and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: r

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed but the shelf is a bit shorter than I wanted
customer_reviews.text: It folds up very nicely, and both the wood and the plastic stand portion are a really nice quality. However, I purchased this to use with textbooks, which, in my case, are slightly wider than 1 1/2". The shelf on this book stand is only 1 5/16" inches, so some of the pages fall over the front of the stand from time to time. Unfortunately, there doesn't appear to be anything on the market that is the depth I want (all the ones I've found--though labeled as if from different companies--seem to have the same dimensions and shelf-folding mechanism), so I don't really have another option. But the high quality at least makes it worthwhile most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dashing Dave

customer_reviews.title: Necessary to save your neck!!
customer_reviews.text: This has saved my life. I absolutely love this book stand! Has made studying so much more easier. I love how adjustable it is. This is perfect! I just wish I got the larger one. I got the 8×11 size. My book hangs off the edges on this book stand and it's hard to highlight, but still it has made reading so much better for me. 7/18/19 UPDATE******* So, I returned the smaller one and got the biggest one and it's amazing. I can now highlight my book easy peasy. I definitely recommend the bigger size!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Don't by a dummy like me and use it right.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so this thing folds in like 3 different ways to become super flat. That's really nice because that makes it much more backpack friendly, even for the Big Size one. However, if you're a dummy like myself, you'll struggle with it not keeping your large textbook open for like the first hour you use it, and then you'll notice that the front ledge the book sits on actually has a locking function to it. Unlocked, it folds, and locked, it, well, it works properly as designed. Holds a magnificently large textbook open for me. I'd absolutely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: MedCityMoto

customer_reviews.title: FITS ALL
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because thick paperbacks gave me problems in holding open. I read while eating and would like all my reading material to be hands-free. This is good looking, totally adjustable, allowing book to be angled back as desired, and with a movable finger on each side that holds pages open. The only hands-on moment is when turning pages: Lift a coiled finger to release page, lift one on the other side to slip it under. Easy-peasy. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Torchwood

customer_reviews.title: too bad !
customer_reviews.text: So, It WAS a good stand- but lasted less than a year. There is a plastic thing in connection that just simply broke. Today it broke and i couldn’t find the way to contact the seller ... i thought it was on warranty for at least one year.ll but you can spend your whole life looking for a way to contact the seller . And maybe there’s a reason the seller doesn’t want to be contacted :) So, the only way to worn other people - is to write tanks.
customer_reviews.author: musicteacher9

customer_reviews.title: This book stand is awesome! I like to read magazines while I eat ...
customer_reviews.text: This book stand is awesome! I like to read magazines while I eat (if I had cats, I'd be a crazy cat lady, too), but they need to be propped up just right. I've been using a flimsy plastic stand, that I probably paid just as much for, for years, when a piece of the support broke off, so I went looking for a replacement. This stand holds my magazine steady at the perfect (adjustable!) angle. It's sturdy and even looks nice on my table.
customer_reviews.author: MereseydotesTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Efficiency at its finest
customer_reviews.text: This book stand is the most useful gadget I've ever purchased. Almost beat by the can opener. In the last week I've had it my life has gotten 100 times easier. No joke. And it's made well. I use it for technical manuals while learning computer programs. Efficiency at its finest.
customer_reviews.author: thebirdsareup

customer_reviews.title: The Most RIGID, lightest, & the greatest "locking" angles (15 settings)designed with portability.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th bookstand I bought. And by far this bookstand is the lightest, the most RIGID (it doesn't rock left to right with a 1,200 page textbook), and the most portable (the bookstand's legs are"locked" at any of 15 different selectable viewing angles. So when you carry the book &the bookstand with you up stairs or carry it to a different rooms, the legs will not collapse, it's locked to your setting and rock solid). Great build quality with the bookstand legs (locking mechanism), and other few features. I am extremly pleased and I would buy it again for my freidns and family.
customer_reviews.author: Don Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love this book stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand is well made and sturdy. The stand is spring loaded and easily adjusts (12 angles) and folds flat. The two padded tension wires are strong and hold any size book open and are easy to move/adjust to see print. I bought 2 more so I have them by the chairs I read in and I use one for my Ipad. I can adjust it to keep the glare off the screen.
customer_reviews.author: PennyJeanAZ

customer_reviews.title: Makes reading textbooks more enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a few months back and used it to hold my 880 page 8.6" x 10.9" review books so that they're at a comfortable viewing angle on my desk. I liked it so much that I bought a second one and am now able to look at two textbooks on my desk comfortably while using my laptop. I recommend it for anyone in college/grad school who doesn't use their textbooks often because of how cumbersome they can be.
customer_reviews.author: Erbie

customer_reviews.title: Best Book Stand I Have Encountered!
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews but this is best book stand I have encountered. Well made, not cheap looking, sturdy. We have 3 kids - elementary, middle, and high school - and they each need one with the amount textbook referencing they do. Holds good sized books and decreases slouching over the desk/table. Also decreases glare from the light bouncing off the textbook when laying flat. I will probably get the middle size one (I got the smallest one) for the high-schooler since the books are getting thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S.

customer_reviews.title: 11.5 one is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: man, i dont know how i lived without this. i am a graduate student and spend house studying. before i would have to put my book under my arms and reach over to my keyboard now i can have this next to my keyboard and type freely. the page holders are awesome! they hold your book open so well without your hands. the ledge is large enough to hold books well and the slope of the book holder is changable to many different levels. this is an awesome product and i would HIGHLY recommend for any student.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book stand
customer_reviews.text: When I take a break (snack or lunch or dinner) I have to watch TV while I eat, when I would prefer to read; I'm an inveterate reader (book/week) and purchase (used) via Amazon hardbound books with covers which I read and then donate to the public library(s). This bookstand quickly unfolds (my wife doesn't want me to leave it unfolded, sitting on and taking up space on the table....if I was a bachelor, I would.....) and I can read a book while I eat. I ordered the large for me....and ordered a medium as a Xmas present for my youngest daughter who likes to cook a lot during holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Clark S

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough for textbooks and the clips are a great touch
customer_reviews.text: I was totally sold on this book stand because I really loved the idea of the page clips. Anyone who owns a book stand knows and hates when their books try to flip pages on them. The alternative is to bend the book's spine and that's just not good for the book. The clips on this book stand keep the pages locked down without obstructing any text, without making it cumbersome to turn the page, and without adding too much heft to the book stand itself. Overall, this has been a great addition to my desk and makes referencing textbooks while working on other things so much easier and less frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: A school supply must have!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I figured it would make taking notes from my textbooks easier as well as doing homework from them. Best investment! I love that it folds down to take on the go with you. It's not super compact when tossed in your bag with laptops/tablet, notebooks, and textbooks. But it works great so I can easily take it with me to work if needed. Holds my thick accounting books with no problem. And helps organize my table a little more sense a propped up textbook takes up a lot less room then one that's laying down :)
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle S.
